content.question: In the circuit shown above, the switch <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is initially in position <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>. After capacitor <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is fully charged, the switch is moved to position <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following graphs best represents the current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> in the resistor <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line on the graph begins at the leftmost point on the horizontal axis and near the top of the vertical axis, and moves downward and to the right at a constant rate, passing through the horizontal axis, and ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and at the lowest point on the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line begins at the leftmost point on the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis, and moves steeply downward and to the right until a point approximately one third of the way across the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis, after which it levels off aligned with the origin and continues horizontally until it ends at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line begins at the origin and moves steeply upward and to the right, reaching a point approximately one third of the way across the horizontal axis and near the top of the vertical axis, after which it levels off at the top of the vertical axis and moves horizontally until it ends at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and three quarters of the way up the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line begins at the leftmost point on the horizontal axis and approximately halfway up the vertical axis, and then fluctuates below and above the horizontal axis at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and aligned with the origin on the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph with the horizontal axis labeled t, and the vertical axis labeled I. The line begins at the leftmost point on the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis, and moves steeply downward and to the right until a point approximately one third of the way across the horizontal axis and near the bottom of the vertical axis, after which it levels off aligned with the origin and continues horizontally until it ends at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis.
